intro: Cheilosa homaliifolia, commonly known as the starry nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters, often at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. Cheilosa homaliifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
